TITLE: Brazil president Jair Bolsonaro hospitalized after abdominal discomfort
SUMMARY: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was taken to a Sao Paulo hospital for tests early Monday after experiencing abdominal discomfort, the government said.

TITLE: 2 armed drones intercepted as they approached Iraqi base hosting US troops: report
SUMMARY: Two drones were intercepted Monday as they neared an Iraqi base that had been housing American forces on the anniversary of the U.S. assassination of a top Iranian commander, a report said.

TITLE: Aoife Beary, a survivor of 2015 Berkeley balcony collapse, dead at 27: report
SUMMARY: A woman who was one of the survivors in the fifth-floor balcony collapse in 2015 that killed six college students in Berkeley, California, died Saturday night after suffering a stroke earlier in the week, according to a report.

SUMMARY: Thousands of protesters in the marched in the streets of Amsterdam on Sunday to protest the government's coronavirus prevention measures, ignoring a ban placed on the demonstrations.

SUMMARY: The number of evangelicals in Spain has been on the rise in recent years.

SUMMARY: GoFundMe paused the fundraising page for the Freedom Convoy 2022 after it surpassed $10 million Wednesday.

TITLE: New Zealand to end quarantine stays and reopen its borders
SUMMARY: New Zealand's government on Thursday said it will end its quarantine requirements for incoming travelers and reopen its borders, a change welcomed by thousands of citizens abroad who have endured long waits to return home.

TITLE: Canadian protesters say no 'hatred' or violence here, they'll be reported to police: 'All on same page'
SUMMARY: Protesters in Ottawa describe the "freedom" protests as peaceful despite Prime Minister Trudeau slamming them as spreading "hateful rhetoric"

TITLE: Who is Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi — the leader of ISIS killed in US raid?
SUMMARY: The Islamic State leader killed Thursday during a U.S. Special Operations forces raid in Syria was working undercover trying to rebuild the terrorist group, carried a gun wherever he went and once was detained by American forces in Iraq nearly 15 years ago, reports say.

TITLE: Aussies say James Cook's ship was found, US says not so fast
SUMMARY: Australian experts said Thursday they believe they've found the wreck of one of the most important ships in the history of the South Pacific after it was scuttled in the U.S. more than 200 years ago.

TITLE: Iran regime’s ‘Death to America’ wrestling head cancels match with US team after visa denial
SUMMARY: Iranian wrestler Alireza Dabir wrote, "I am very sorry to announce that the national wrestling team of the Islamic Republic of Iran ... is not able to participate in a friendly match" against the U.S.

TITLE: Sweden joins others in announcing end of virus restrictions
SUMMARY: Sweden on Thursday joined other European nations in saying it will remove coronavirus restrictions.

TITLE: Ex-top drug cop in Bolivia charged with cocaine trafficking
SUMMARY: A former Bolivian antinarcotics chief has been charged in the U.S. with conspiring to provide top-level protection for cocaine shipments to the United States.

TITLE: UK's Boris Johnson loses 4 senior aides amid Partygate scandal
SUMMARY: Four of Boris Johnson’s most senior staff quit on Thursday, triggering new turmoil for the embattled British prime minister.

TITLE: Canadian 'Freedom Convoy' lawyers demand GoFundMe lift frozen funds
SUMMARY: Legal counsel retained by the Freedom Convoy 2022 in Canada is demanding that GoFundMe lift the ban on the organization after the crowdfunding site shut down their fundraising page.

TITLE: White House disputes claims China's economic support may handicap Russian sanctions
SUMMARY: The U.S. believes it has a technology and production advantage that will help limit any Chinese support for Russia in the event of economic sanctions.

TITLE: Pentagon: US expects new ISIS leader to ‘step up’ as they ‘would like to continue to attack the West’
SUMMARY: Pentagon Press Secretary John Kirby said Friday that the U.S. believes someone in ISIS is going to “step up to try to lead the group” following the killing of their former leader in Syria, as the militants “would like to continue to attack the West, even our homeland.”

TITLE: Daughter of imprisoned Uyghur scholar concerned China using Olympics as a propaganda tool
SUMMARY: Jewher Ilham, daughter of an imprisoned Uyghur scholar, said she is concerned the Olympic Games will benefit the Chinese governement.

TITLE: Kabul airport Abbey Gate explosion was single blast, no follow-up enemy gunfire: Pentagon
SUMMARY: The suicide bomb attack at the Abbey Gate of Hamid Karzai International Airport in Afghanistan that killed 13 U.S. servicemembers and injured at least 170 civilians was conducted by a single attacker and was not followed up by enemy gunfire, the Pentagon said Friday.

TITLE: Putin seems to doze when Ukraine athletes enter during Winter Olympics opening ceremony, social media buzzes
SUMMARY: Social media users are speculating as to whether Russian President Vladimir Putin had fallen asleep during the opening ceremony of the Winter Olympics in Beijing after he was seen on camera with his eyes closed.

TITLE: Supporters rally around Canadian trucker convoy providing food, gas and rides
SUMMARY: Canadian truckers in Freedom Convoy describe being overwhelmed by the support shown from fellow protesters.

TITLE: Canadian man drives SUV through group of Freedom Convoy protesters, injuring 4
SUMMARY: A Canadian man is facing criminal charges after plowing through a group of protesters taking part in the Freedom Convoy of truckers protesting the country’s coronavirus vaccine mandates.

TITLE: Mass swarm of dead fish in Atlantic prompts European inquiry
SUMMARY: France and the European Union are investigating why a massive swarm of dead fish was released by a huge trawler in the Atlantic Ocean off France, after an environmental group released dramatic video and photos of the incident.

TITLE: Five-year-old Moroccan boy trapped in well dies from injuries
SUMMARY: A Moroccan boy stuck deep in a well for several days has been successfully pulled out but did not survive.

TITLE: US combat soldiers land in Poland amid Russia-Ukraine tensions
SUMMARY: The troops deployed within 24 hours of notice and split between Poland and Germany, where they established a combined joint task force.

TITLE: Queen backs plan to one day call son’s wife 'Queen Camilla'
SUMMARY: Queen Elizabeth II offered her support Saturday to have the Duchess of Cornwall become Queen Camilla — using a special Platinum Jubilee message to make a significant decision in shaping the future of the British monarchy.

TITLE: Moroccan boy, 5, trapped in well dead despite rescue effort
SUMMARY: A Moroccan boy stuck deep in a well for several days was successfully pulled out but did not survive.

TITLE: China increases Middle East investment as US backs out of region
SUMMARY: The Belt and Road Initiative would help China impose greater influence over Central Asia and the Middle East through increasing trade and construction contracts.

TITLE: Ottawa mayor declares state of emergency as police threaten arrests for bringing gas to Freedom Convoy
SUMMARY: The mayor of Ottawa declared a state of emergency Sunday afternoon as approximately 500 trucks and vehicles with the "Freedom Convoy" continue to linger in streets of the Canadian capital.

TITLE: Canadian-style trucker protests spread throughout the world
SUMMARY: Following the example of the thousands of Canadian truckers protesting COVID-19 vaccine mandates in the capital of Ottawa, truckers in other countries have begun organizing their own versions of the "Freedom Convoy."

TITLE: Ukraine defense chief urges 'calm' as fears of Russian invasion build
SUMMARY: Ukraine’s leaders are telling their people to "keep calm" despite dire warnings from the White House and Pentagon over the growing number of Russian forces on its border.

TITLE: Canada 'Freedom Convoy': Ottawa police arrest 7, threaten charges for others caught bringing fuel to truckers
SUMMARY: Canadian police announced Monday that seven people have been arrested and more than 100 have been issued tickets in connection to "demonstration-related enforcement" in Ottawa.

TITLE: Video shows Navy jet crashing onto deck of USS Carl Vinson in South China Sea
SUMMARY: A stunning video circulating on social media that appears to show the moment an F-35C Lightning II jet crashed into the deck of a U.S. aircraft carrier in the South China Sea is authentic, a Navy spokesperson has revealed.

TITLE: Iran 'sham' trial of California resident sparks allegations that world powers have abandoned him
SUMMARY: Jamshid Sharmahd, a German Iranian dissident and long-term legal resident of California who was abducted by Iran’s regime in Dubai in 2020, went on trial and could face the death penalty over what critics are calling false links to a deadly bombing at a mosque in 2008.

TITLE: UK archeologists unearth Roman-era cemetery holding dozens of decapitated skeletons
SUMMARY: A high-speed rail project led to the gruesome discovery of dozens of decapitated corpses just outside a major metropolis.

TITLE: Judge bans honking from truckers in downtown Ottawa for 10 days
SUMMARY: An Ontario judge granted a 10-day injunction on Monday that forbids truckers parked on city streets in downtown Ottawa from constantly honking their horns.

TITLE: Canadian truckers shut down busiest border crossing in North America, backs up Detroit roads
SUMMARY: The Freedom Convoy of truckers protesting Canada's vaccine mandates caused the Ambassador Bridge to shut down, causing delays on Detroit roads

TITLE: Canadian truckers shut down busiest border crossing in North America, back up Detroit roads
SUMMARY: The Freedom Convoy of truckers protesting Canada's vaccine mandates caused the Ambassador Bridge to shut down, causing delays on Detroit roads

TITLE: Retired Pope Benedict XVI asks for forgiveness over handling of clergy sex abuse cases, but denies wrongdoing
SUMMARY: Retired Pope Benedict XVI asked forgiveness Tuesday for any “grievous faults" in his handling of clergy sex abuse cases, but denied any personal or specific wrongdoing after an independent report criticized his actions in four cases while he was archbishop of Munich, Germany.

TITLE: CCP mouthpiece attacks Holocaust museum for condemning China's Uyghur genocide
SUMMARY: Chinese Communist Party spokesperson: 'Shame on the Holocaust Museum!'

TITLE: Poland prepares for 'up to a million' refugees fleeing Ukraine as Russian threat continues: report
SUMMARY: Poland has braced itself to receive "up to a million refugees" fleeing Ukraine if Russia invades the former Soviet nation.

TITLE: Biden admin reveals ex-Honduran leader on list of corrupt Central American officials
SUMMARY: The Biden administration placed former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández on a classified list of officials suspected of corruption or undermining democracy in Central America.

TITLE: Canadian provinces begin backing off vaccine mandates amid lingering Freedom Convoy protests
SUMMARY: Some Canadian provinces have announced they are rescinding their vaccine mandates as trucker protests block major arteries on the Canada-U.S. border and continue to clog the Canadian capital despite a crackdown from Ottawa Police.

TITLE: Canadian great-grandfather who honked in support of truckers aggressively arrested by police, family claims
SUMMARY: The family of a Canadian great-grandfather who was stopped for “unnecessary noise” in Ottawa because he honked his horn in support of protesting truckers allege a police officer who arrested him was overly aggressive Sunday, according to reports.

TITLE: North Korea claims it can hit US, 'shake the world' with missile after month of increased testing
SUMMARY: North Korea created the Hwasong-15 missile in 2017 and has not tested since then, but Kim Jong Un's government has completed a flurry of missile tests in January, including a supposed hypersonic glide vehicle.

TITLE: Canadian truckers feel vilified by Trudeau
SUMMARY: Canadian truckers describe feeling vilified by the way Prime Minister Trudeau portrayed the "Freedom Convoy" protest.

TITLE: Sweden ends COVID-19 testing requirements, eases restrictions
SUMMARY: Sweden has halted wide-scale testing for COVID-19 even among people showing symptoms of an infection, putting an end to the mobile city-square tent sites, drive-in swab centers and home-delivered tests that became ubiquitous during the pandemic and provided essential data for tracking its spread.

TITLE: Mexico now the 'dominant source' for fentanyl in US, mainly comes through southern border, report finds
SUMMARY: Mexico is now the dominant source for fentanyl coming into the United States, a new report released this week has found -- with most of the deadly drug coming in through the southern border.

TITLE: When will the Freedom Convoy protest end?
SUMMARY: Canadian truck drivers told Fox News when they expect the "Freedom Convoy" protests to end.

TITLE: Canadian truckers inspire anti-vaccine mandate protests in France
SUMMARY: Inspired by the Freedom Convoy of Canadian truckers protesting their government's vaccine mandate, a group of protesters gathered together in France Wednesday for a “Convoi de la Liberté” of their own.

TITLE: Turkey steps up Ukraine support as Germany remains distant
SUMMARY: Turkey's recent troubles with Europe may overshadow its contributions to defending Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity.

TITLE: Local Ottawans 'fed up' with Canada's trucker protest
SUMMARY: Ottawans describe the impact the "Freedom Convoy" protest has had on the city.

TITLE: European nations scaling back coronavirus measures in big ways
SUMMARY: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced new plans Wednesday to lift remaining coronavirus restrictions within just weeks, making the U.K. one of several European countries in the process of rolling back COVID-19 protocols significantly.

TITLE: Paris police ban French ‘Freedom Convoy’ demonstrations in city, threaten prison time if traffic blocked
SUMMARY: French police on Thursday banned demonstrations in Paris through the weekend in anticipation of a “Freedom Convoy” of anti-vaccine mandate protesters arriving in the capital city by Friday.

TITLE: Ottawa Freedom Convoy: Nonprofit sets up free legal hotline to assist truckers
SUMMARY: The Justice Centre for Constitutional Freedoms, a legal nonpartisan charity, announced the creation of "a network of defense lawyers to assist any Canadian truckers peacefully protesting for freedom from coronavirus restrictions and vaccine mandates."

TITLE: Rep. Chip Roy publishes letter in solidarity with Finnish Christian on trial for 'hate speech'
SUMMARY: Former Minister of the Interior Dr. Päivi Räsänen was charged after talking about her religious views regarding sex and marriage.

TITLE: For some Afghans, permission to leave comes too late as military veterans race to get them to safety
SUMMARY: Matt Nelson of Save Our Allies, one of the private veterans groups helping Afghans escape through a network of safe houses and private donations, said the bureaucracy is still taking too long.

TITLE: China winter Olympics: NASA imagery shows huge amounts of artificial snow used in Beijing
SUMMARY: New satellite imagery released by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration is shining light on just how much artificial snow is being used for the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing.

TITLE: Ontario court freezes millions in trucker Freedom Convoy's crowdfunding account
SUMMARY: A court in Ontario froze access to the millions of dollars in the GiveSendGo account of the Freedom Convoy 2022 on Thursday.

TITLE: 'We're not backing down': Canadian truckers share message to Trudeau
SUMMARY: Canadian truckers tell Fox News their message for Prime Minister Justin Trudeau

TITLE: Russia-Ukraine tensions build to 'dangerous moment,' NATO warns
SUMMARY: Russia and Belarus have launched the largest joint military exercises since the Cold War, with 30,000 Russian troops taking part, according to U.S. military estimates.

TITLE: Macron refused to take Russian COVID test over fear Putin would nab DNA: report
SUMMARY: French President Emmanuel Macron refused a Russian COVID-19 test during his visit with Russian President Vladimir Putin due to fears that Russian authorities could use the test to obtain his DNA, according to a report.
